JobFullDesc:
uShip is seeking a Product Marketing Manager that is responsible for clear communication and successful product presentation in the marketplace. This role is the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in sales and marketing to achieve results. You will be the evangelist of uShip and play an integral role in organizing product launches. You will also be responsible for creating product messaging, developing subject matter expertise, enabling sales, analyzing competitors, and leading go-to-market process for new releases. The ideal candidate has a passion for the strategic value of product marketing, while also being data-driven and detail-oriented in execution. In short, we’re looking for someone with a track record of knowing the customer, knowing our secret sauce, and connecting the two.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES


Market intelligence: be the expert on our customers, both shippers and carriers, who they are, how they make their shipping/carrier decisions.
Understand the Competitive Landscape: be an expert on our competition and how they are positioned.
Product Positioning: Collaborate with product management and marketing communications to develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with our target buyer personas.
Customer Journey: Understand and document our customer’s process, including where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind the decisions they make.
Messaging: Develop product messaging that differentiates new products from others in the market.
Support Partnerships: Develop internal tools and external collateral and teach them how and when to use it.
GTM: Own the go-to-market process which includes leading a cross-functional team to ensure products are released in the most effective way.
Content: Collaborate with the Content Marketing team to identify content themes and create collateral such as e-books, case studies, etc.

WHO YOU ARE & WHAT MAKES YOU QUALIFIED


A bachelor degree in Business, Marketing, Journalism, Communications, or a related field, or equivalent experience
5+ years of marketing experience in a technology company, including 2+ years  specifically in product marketing
Logistics industry experience is preferred
Both speaking and writing abilities are key in this role via presenting about new products, writing engaging copy, and telling the ‘story’ of uShip products
An understanding and familiarity with early stage product development, as well as the Software as a Service (SaaS) business model and the marketing technology landscape
Ability to think strategically and act tactically
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects
Exceptional research and analytical abilities
Working knowledge of Google Docs, Google Sheets, Microsoft Powerpoint, and Microsoft Excel
